title: Invention of the Printing Press
description: Johannes Gutenberg invents the printing press around 1440, revolutionizing how knowledge and ideas spread across Europe.

title: Discovery of America
description: In 1492, Christopher Columbus embarks on his first voyage across the Atlantic and reaches the Americas, marking the beginning of the Age of Exploration.

title: French Revolution
description: The French Revolution begins in 1789, leading to the fall of the monarchy and major social and political upheavals in France.

title: Industrial Revolution
description: The Industrial Revolution starts in the late 18th century in Britain, transforming economies from agrarian to industrial through innovations in machinery and energy.

title: American Civil War
description: The American Civil War, fought from 1861 to 1865, determines the survival of the United States and leads to the abolition of slavery.

title: First Powered Flight
description: On December 17, 1903, the Wright brothers achieve the first controlled, sustained flight of a powered aircraft in Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.

title: World War I Begins
description: World War I starts in 1914 after the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand, resulting in one of the deadliest conflicts in human history.

title: Moon Landing
description: On July 20, 1969, Apollo 11 lands the first humans on the Moon, as Neil Armstrong takes his historic first step.

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
description: In 1989, the Berlin Wall falls, ending decades of separation between East and West Berlin and symbolizing the end of the Cold War.

title: Rise of the Internet
description: The 1990s mark the explosion of the World Wide Web, revolutionizing communication, commerce, and culture worldwide.
